intro: Seridia sphaerocephala, commonly known as the globe-headed seridia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, spherical shape and dense, woolly foliage that helps it conserve moisture in harsh environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a delicate touch of color to its otherwise muted appearance. Its unique morphology makes it well adapted to survive in low-water conditions. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking form and drought tolerance.
